newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungarian police to get Opel, Suzuki cars.
newsitem.headline: Hungarian police to get Opel, Suzuki cars.

text.p: Opel Hungary Ltd (OH) said on Thursday it will supply over 900 cars worth nearly 2.5 billion forints to the Hungarian police through a tender from the Ministry of Interior.

Hungarian automaker Magyar Suzuki Rt (MS), majority owned by Suzuki Motor Corp, will supply some 200 cars in winning the rest of the 3.0 billion forint tender, the largest police car order since 1990.
Opel Hungary, a division of General Motors Corp's German subsidiary Adam Opel AG, will supply at least 915 Hungarian-built Opel Astra hatchbacks with 1.6-litre engines, OH said.
MS officials could not be reached for comment, but the company's deliveries will include Suzuki Vitara off-road vehicles, which are not currently made in Hungary, OH said.
All vehicles will be delivered by March 1998, OH said.
